name: Amelia Hotel at the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first trip to N.E. Florida was to Amelia Island and the town of Fernandina Beach. We stayed at the Amelia Hotel and Suites for it's convenient location and easy access to the beach. The hotel was comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was ok for families with small children. The room rates were lower than the area's average and the quick walk to the beach made it easy to go back and forth as conditions changed during the day. The central location of the hotel made it easy to get around the island and see all the sights!
reviews.title: August can be cool!

reviews.text: Good Value, Very nice large room with clean soft bed, comfortable furniture. Did not get ocean view due to Wedding at Hotel, but happy anyway. Nice lobby, nice check-in. Great location. Directly across road from beach access/park and Sliders & TIKI Bar. Staff was pleasant & welcoming. Will definately stay again. Morning Coffee & light breakfast good too.
reviews.title: Incredible Beds, Well kept hotel

reviews.text: We were not going to be able to make our annual trip to Amelia Island this year until the staff at the Amelia Hotel made it possible by offering us a rate that fit into our budget. Thank you so much. We stayed here last year and this year was no different. It is a very clean hotel and the complimentary breakfast is outstanding with a variety of hot and cold foods. The location makes for a very short walk to the beach. Our room was not a beach view room. The only downside to our stay was the inconsistent wireless internet access in our room. If we don't stay in a condo the Amelia Hotel is our first choice.
reviews.title: Happy Beach Bums

reviews.text: We ended up staying at the Amelia Hotel due to my son's wedding. We had extended family in, groomsmen,brides family and the honeymoon couple. Our stay was so relaxed and enjoyable due to a very special person who works for the hotel and her name is Elizabeth Thompson. She went out of her way to make our stay enjoyable and the honeymoon couples stay very memorable. I hope the hotel realizes what a valuable asset they have in her. If we needed something either she took care of it for us or told us where we could go to get it taken care of. Our room was so relaxing and roomy which is exactly what we needed due to all the groomsmen ended up in our room to change. So thank god Elizabeth recommended the size we would need to accomodate all of them and us too. The beds very extremely comfortable and relaxing which is what we needed by time everything was over. You could walk out of the hotel cross the street and you were on the beach. The rates where very reasonable considering the time of year it was. Our trip was overall memorable and relaxing and I'm sure my son will have memories to last him a life time.
reviews.title: Wedding Party

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable rooms and beds, excellent location, very friendly and helpful staff. Everything you would expect from a family owned and operated establishment.
reviews.title: I'll be back! :)

reviews.text: We have reservations again for this summer! Nice rooms and we always sleep like babies. Lots of pillows and good A.C. Fabulous location. Ate at Sliders the first year. Average restaurant but great atmosphere. Kids loved the playground and we could enjoy ourselves while watching them play. The beach is RIGHT there. After we would eat breakfast each morning, which is more than enough for breakfast, we would go to beach and spend 3-4 hrs and then come rinse in pool shower and swim for about an hour. Pool is not in great position, as it is average and located right in middle of parking lot but all other amenities make up for this. We make this our yearly tradition. We also eat at Tony's Brick Oven Pizza on Sadler EVERY year. Love it. Crab Trap, not so good. The Surf- yum and good atmosphere.
reviews.title: We stay here every year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying at this hotel it is clear that Amelia Hotel at the Beach employees are also probably the ones being paid to LIE and write these reviews. If you've seen pictures of this hotel on the website - please don't expect to see that when you pull up. I'm not sure who their photographer was, but whomever it was, deserves an award! The pictures are completely misleading!
reviews.title: BEWARE!!!! DIRTY ROOMS! REEKS OF MOLD AND SMOKE! STAFF ARE LIARS & CHEATS!!!‎

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once stepping inside the hotel I'm overwhelmed with musty and moldy smells. Disgusting. Figuring it might just be the lobby and it will get better when we get into our room we trekked on in.
reviews.title: It's your home-away-from home...without the work! Great place for R&R!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING. This is coming from someone who travels A LOT. I have been to 5 star hotels and I've also stayed at 1 star hotels. I wouldn't have paid more than $40 to sleep in this hotel. DEFINITELY NOT the $130 I spent to stay here a night. The toilet didn't work, the bed linens had RIPS IN THEM, actual tears that looked like someone took a knife to them. Not only was it disturbing but it was hardly sanitary! The carpets were dirty and reeked of mold and filth. I didn't want to take my flip-flops off!
reviews.title: The Location Makes the Difference

reviews.text: We tried calling other local hotels and they were booked solid until the following night. We went to the front desk clerk and asked them if it would be possible to cancel our reservation for the following night. The woman at the front desk, Nicole, was very nice and said "No problem at all this happens all the time! Just have Expedia call us up and we'll approve the refund! No big deal!" We thought to ourselves well this might be the best part of the hotel - friendly staff. BOY WERE WE WRONG.
reviews.title: Reasonable rates and good location

reviews.text: Will Return, Great rooms and very clean. Staff great, food good. We were working at the Antique show. We will come back...................
reviews.title: What a great View, 3rd floor room the best... Looking at the water.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous hotel with a great staff, free breakfast.
reviews.title: Fantastic service ,very clean, great location, fabulous bed linens

reviews.text: Huge room with a fantastic oceanview
reviews.title: Perfect for my family!
Fantastic hotel for me
reviews.text: bathroom was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel, wonderful location for not direct oceanfront. Hotel is across the street from Sliders (yum!) and an oceanside park. I enjoyed the full breaskfast served every morning and the warm cookies served in the afternoon---all included in hotel rate of course. Pool location is not good. It is beside the back of the hotel and the parking lot. Hotel staff was great, especially the maids. They were so helpful and so pleasant. I look forward to staying here again and I wouldn't really consider staying at another hotel.
reviews.title: Very Noisy

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights at the hotel and we were very impressed for not being a typical chain hotel. The rooms were great. We stayed in a king with a pull out sofa and it worked well for the 3 of us. The hotel was across the street from the beach access and it was about in the center of the island. The staff we dealt with was great and it seemed to make the hotel more plesent. Would recommend to any one coming to the island.
reviews.title: Very nice with just the right location and price. Would stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great for the beach! Just 100 yard walk to the shore! And just a short drive into town. Stay here and you won't regret it.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: We stayed for a week and from the time we entered, til we left, the staff made sure my family was treated well. The room was very clean. Jessica, our reservation clerk, greeted us by name every morning. The staff pointed out cookies on the counter on our way in from the beach-a great snack for tired children. Housekeeping made sure to replace towels just by noticing them when we opened the door. The pool was well-maintained and the breakfast was great. I would highly recommed this for families. We will DEFINITELY be back again.
reviews.title: Absolutely FABULOUS!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Amelia Hotel was wonderful. My husband and I stayed there last weeked for our anniversary. The rooms are well kept and have better furnishings than most hotels... similar to Tommy Bahama style. The hotel is across the street from the beach, so you can't do much better than that. Breakfast was OK. I played it safe with cereal and yogurt, but they also had some hot food. The staff are fabulous... extremely friendly and helpful!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: We ate at a place downtown for lunch called Cafe Caribo and it was excellent. Also ate at the Surf for dinner, which has great outdoor atmosphere and decent food. Also ate across the street at sliders. Again, great outdoor atmosphere, but mediocre at best food.
reviews.title: Good location, Clean, Good Sleep with mini-fridge and microwave

description: Amelia Hotel & Suites on Amelia Island features 86 rooms, some suites with whirlpool and balcony with partial views of the beach and ocean. We offer outdoor pool, complimentary Hot N Healthy breakfast and Wi-Fi Internet. The famous Amelia Island/Fernandina beaches are just steps from our front doors, and we are just minutes to the historical Fernandina downtown area, and of course, our renowned Fernandina Beach golf courses. We also have facilities for small meetings, Beach Weddings and family events.
